Package client

Class DFSOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
client.DFSOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class DFSOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
Output stream directed to a file in the distributed filesystem.

Write calls on a DFSOutputStream are directed to a storage server hosting the given file. Each call corresponds to one network request. If this is not desirable, the DFSOutputStream should be wrapped in a BufferedOutputStream object.

Creating a DFSOutputStream for a file does not cause the file to be created or truncated. The file must exist, and the existing file data is left in place. Writes to the stream cause file data to be overwritten, starting from the beginning of the file.

  • Constructor Details

    • DFSOutputStream

      public DFSOutputStream​(Service naming_server, Path file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.
      Parameters:
      naming_server - Stub for the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
      file - Path to the file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
      java.io.IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

    • DFSOutputStream

      public DFSOutputStream​(java.lang.String hostname, Path file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

      The naming server is contacted on the default client interface port.

      Parameters:
      hostname - Address of the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
      file - Path to the file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
      java.io.IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

    • DFSOutputStream

      public DFSOutputStream​(Service naming_server, java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.
      Parameters:
      naming_server - Stub for the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
      filename - Path to the file, as a string.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
      java.io.IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

    • DFSOutputStream

      public DFSOutputStream​(java.lang.String hostname, java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

      The naming server is contacted on the default client interface port.

      Parameters:
      hostname - Address of the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
      filename - Path to the file, as a string.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
      java.io.IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes the output stream.

      The stream is marked as closed. Further attempts to use the output stream will result in IOException.

      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class java.io.OutputStream
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • write

      public void write​(byte[] buffer, int buffer_offset, int write_length) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes bytes from a buffer to the output stream.

      The write is performed in a single request to the storage server.

      Overrides:
      write in class java.io.OutputStream
      Parameters:
      buffer - Buffer containing bytes to be written.
      buffer_offset - Offset into the buffer from which bytes are to be written.
      write_length - Number of bytes to be written.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the stream is closed, if the storage server cannot be contacted, or if a write error occurs on the storage server.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - If buffer is null.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If buffer_offset or write_length is negative, or if buffer_offset + write_length exceeds the length of the given buffer.

    • write

      public void write​(int b) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a single byte to the output stream.
      Specified by:
      write in class java.io.OutputStream
      Parameters:
      b - Value of the byte to be written. The argument is taken modulo 256 to obtain the byte value.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the stream is closed, if the storage server cannot be contacted, or if a write error occurs on the storage server.

    • skip

      public void skip​(long count) throws java.io.IOException
      Advances the stream offset.

      It is possible to advance the offset past the current end of file.

      Parameters:
      count - Number of bytes to advance stream offset by.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the stream has been closed.
